description: The New York Giants have signed quarterback Russell Wilson to a one-year contract, according to multiple reports.
title: New York Giants sign veteran QB Russell Wilson to 1-year deal

description: President Trump said his national security advisor does not need to apologize after a reporter said Michael Waltz mistakenly invited him into an encrypted group chat about military operations. Democrats accused the Trump officials of a security breach. NBC News’ Peter Alexander reports.
title: Democrats grill Trump officials over leaked group chat

description: Virginia police looking into the death of former U.S. Attorney Jessica Aber say everything they have found suggests natural causes.
title: Evidence in death of former U.S. attorney points to natural causes, police say

description: Finalizing applications filed by certain immigrants to become legal permanent residents is being put on hold to comply with an executive order President Donald Trump signed in January.
title: Trump administration stops processing some green cards 'to do more vetting'

description: Rep. Anna Paulina Luna is clashing with Speaker Mike Johnson over her push to pass legislation that would allow lawmakers who are new parents to vote remotely.
title: GOP lawmaker and Speaker Mike Johnson clash over proxy voting for new parents

description: An office manager at a VA center in Wyoming, where the veteran suicide rate is 50% higher than the national average, was fired despite a glowing job review.
title: In Wyoming, DOGE cuts spark fears of impacts to veterans in crisis

description: TikTok has stopped allowing people to search for videos featuring the use of an artificial intelligence “chubby” filter after users criticized it as a form of body shaming.
title: Videos of AI ‘chubby filter’ removed from TikTok after critics call out body shaming

description: Republican lawmakers are ramping up their attacks on the judiciary — and rushing to demonstrate they are in lockstep with President Donald Trump — amid court rulings that have blocked his agenda.
title: Republicans escalate their efforts to rein in judges: From the Politics Desk

description: As measles cases rise, some parents are giving their children the measles vaccine earlier. This bonus dose can be given to kids as young as 6 months.
title: Babies under 1 typically don’t get the measles vaccine. Can they get a dose early?

description: The FDA approved a new antibiotic for UTIs from drugmaker GSK. The drug, Blujepa, is for women and girls ages 12 and up.
title: FDA approves first new antibiotic for UTIs in nearly 30 years

description: A Native American tribe in southeastern Arizona is pushing for tighter regulations on group homes after 14-year-old Emily Pike was found dismembered weeks after sneaking out her bedroom window.
title: Death of Emily Pike, teen found dismembered in Arizona, spurs calls for regulation of group homes

description: NANJING, China — World Athletics President Sebastian Coe said Tuesday that the track and field’s governing body has approved the introduction of cheek swabs and dry blood-spot tests for female athletes in order to maintain “the integrity of competition.”
title: World Athletics to require chromosome testing of women’s track and field athletes

description: A drug trafficker was sentenced to 24 years in prison Tuesday along with two others for a conspiracy to bring in more than a ton of cocaine into the U.S. from Colombia, federal officials said.
title: Colombian trafficker who was working to smuggle a ton of cocaine into U.S.  sentenced to 24 years

description: A federal judge in New York has dismissed racketeering allegations against Sean Combs in a $30 million sexual assault and harassment lawsuit brought by a producer who worked on his most recent album.
title: Racketeering claims against Sean Combs dismissed in producer's sexual assault lawsuit

description: Stanford is parting ways with football coach Troy Taylor amid allegations he mistreated female staff members.
title: Stanford football coach fired following report he mistreated female staff members

description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is pulling back $11.4 billion in funds allocated in response to Covid to state and community health departments.
title: CDC is pulling back $11B in Covid funding sent to health departments across the U.S.

description: A doctor attempted to kill his wife while they were hiking in Hawaii, first by trying to push her off the trail and then by hitting her in the head with a rock, officials said Tuesday.
title: Doctor tried to kill wife by pushing her off trail and bashing her with rock, Hawaii police say

description: At the sold-out T Boy Wrestling 2.0 competition, organized by Trans Dudes of LA, the performers reminded the crowd that wrestling is hot, and that a life well lived is the best revenge of all.
title: These trans wrestlers put their own spin on masculinity

description: Costa Rica officials reversed a preliminary cause of death for the teen son of former New York Yankees star Brett Gardner, saying Miller Gardner did not die by asphyxia after eating something that made him sick.
title: Teen son of ex-Yankees star Brett Gardner did not die by asphyxia, Costa Rica officials now say

description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the Social Security Administration, Frank Bisignano, got an earful from Senate Democrats at his confirmation hearing Tuesday, in the wake of early actions by Elon Musk and the Department of Government Efficiency to downsize the agency.
title: Democrats grill Social Security nominee over disruptions as Republicans defend Trump

description: A Pennsylvania city employee who called police in January to report a noose she found on her desk is now accused of placing it there herself.
title: Penn. city worker who told police someone put a noose on her desk now accused of doing it herself

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump meets with U.S. ambassadors at the White House.
title: Trump meets with U.S. ambassadors

description: Facing pressure from his right flank to take on judges who have ruled against President Donald Trump, Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., on Tuesday floated the possibility of Congress eliminating federal courts.
title: Speaker Mike Johnson floats eliminating federal courts as GOP ramps up attacks on judges

description: There’s been a murder at the White House and detective Cordelia Cupp investigates whodunit in “The Residence,” on Netflix, starring Emmy winner Uzo Aduba.
title: Uzo Aduba leads White House mystery series 'The Residence'

description: To get by these days, more young adults turn to a likely source for help: their parents.
title: 50% of parents financially support adult children, report finds. Here's how much it costs them.

description: For the first time in nearly 10 years, a Berkshire Hathaway employee claimed Warren Buffett’s $1 million grand prize for his company’s NCAA bracket contest.
title: Berkshire Hathaway employee wins $1 million in Warren Buffett's March Madness bracket challenge

description: Chinese automaker BYD reported annual revenue of 777 billion yuan ($107 billion) for 2024, leapfrogging U.S. rival Tesla as competition between the two electric vehicle rivals heats up.
title: Chinese EV giant BYD outpaces Tesla with annual sales of more than $100 billion

description: Private credit has exploded in popularity among investors, with the market soaring from $1 trillion in 2020 to $1.5 trillion at the beginning of 2024, according to alternative data provider Preqin.
title: How the rich use insurance to invest in private credit without steep tax bills

description: Casa Frida, which aids LGBTQ migrants fleeing identity-based violence, lost 60% of its funds after Trump ordered the suspension of foreign assistance programs.
title: How a shelter hit by Trump's aid cuts protects LGBTQ migrants in Mexico

description: One of the Kremlin’s newest threats, according to NATO, is targeting undersea cables carrying vast quantities of data and power beneath the Baltic Sea.
title: The high-stakes geopolitical game unfolding in the Baltic Sea

description: Investigators recovered $770,000 worth of stolen Tiffany & Co. earrings last week after the alleged thief who swallowed the jewelry "expelled" them from his system, Florida police said.
title: Thief who swallowed $770K worth of Tiffany earrings 'expelled' them over 12 days later

description: Fintech lender Affirm said Tuesday that it’s reached an agreement with JPMorgan Chase to offer its buy now, pay later loan services to merchants on the bank’s payments network.
title: Affirm announces JPMorgan Chase merchants can now offer installment loans at checkout

description: The White House has confirmed that Ukraine and Russia have agreed to a ceasefire agreement to eliminate the use of force in the Black Sea and attacks on energy infrastructure. NBC News' Kelly O'Donnell has details on the agreement and what could come next for the ongoing conflict.
title: Ukraine and Russia agree to Black Sea and energy infrastructure ceasefire

description: A measure of consumers’ short-term expectations has fallen to its lowest level in 12 years, ticking a figure that has historically signaled recessions ahead.
title: Consumer expectations plunge to their lowest level in 12 years as recession signal blares

description: Former UFC champ Cain Velasquez was sentenced to five years in prison for the attempted murder of a man accused of molesting his relative during an emotionally fraught Monday hearing.
title: Former UFC champ sentenced to 5 years after shooting man who allegedly molested his relative

description: A hearing will be held on Tuesday for detained Columbia graduate student Mahmoud Khalil and seven other students who are attempting to block the university from sharing private disciplinary records with a GOP-led House committee.
title: Hearing to be held for Mahmoud Khalil and other Columbia students

description: One of the attorneys said the Venezuelans they represent are not members of the Tren de Aragua gang, had migrated from their country and “don’t have any criminal record.”
title: Venezuela-hired lawyers file petition in El Salvador to free Venezuelans deported by U.S.

description: During questioning from Sen. Mark Warner, D-Va., DNI Tulsi Gabbard refused to answer if she was included in a group chat about military strikes in Yemen that accidentally included a journalist and said the communications did not contain classified information. CIA Dir. John Ratcliffe also said his messages in the chat also did not include anything that was classified, but Sen. Warner pressed him on why the messages had not been shared with his committee.
title: Gabbard and Ratcliffe say Yemen strike chat did not have classified information

description: Turkey has been rocked by six nights of protests over the imprisonment of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, a major rival of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
title: Huge pro-democracy protests grip Turkey after Erdogan rival is imprisoned

description: Transgender Americans are asking a judge to block Trump's policy requiring them to receive passports that list their birth sex.
title: Transgender Americans aim to block Trump's passport policy change

description: Star Los Angeles Dodgers outfielder Mookie Betts' body is "just kind of eating itself," he said this week, as a mystery illness has cost him more than 20 pounds and kept him out of action this young 2025 season.
title: Dodgers star Mookie Betts struck by mystery illness: 'My body's just kind of eating itself'

description: Watch live coverage as the Senate Intelligence Committee holds its worldwide threats hearing with intelligence leaders including DNI Tulsi Gabbard, FBI Dir. Kash Patel and CIA Dir. John Ratcliffe. The hearing comes a day after a journalist from The Atlantic revealed he was inadvertently included in a Signal thread about U.S. plans to strike Houthis in Yemen.
title: Intelligence leaders testify at Senate worldwide threats hearing

description: A United Airlines flight headed to Shanghai, China, had to turn around over the weekend after the pilot forgot to bring a passport, the airline company said.
title: United Airlines flight to China diverted to San Francisco after pilot forgets passport

description: Trump stood by his national security adviser Michael Waltz after The Atlantic's editor-in-chief was accidentally added to a private, high-level chat where military plans were being discussed, calling the situation a "glitch."
title: Trump stands by national security adviser despite leaked military plans: He 'learned a lesson'

description: The FBI has launched a task force to investigate a spate of recent attacks targeting Tesla cars and dealerships, as the agency's director calls such acts “domestic terrorism.”
title: FBI launches task force to crack down on attacks against Tesla

description: A Columbia University student who took part in campus protests against Israel's military offensive in Gaza is facing deportation, according to a Monday lawsuit.
title: Columbia protester Yunseo Chung sues Trump administration to prevent deportation

description: A recent survey found 42% of people are so fed up with high prices that they are leaving snacks and junk food off their grocery lists. This has led some companies to feed into new strategies to lure customers back. NBC’s Christine Romans reports for TODAY.
title: Rising costs of popular snacks has some shoppers cutting back

description: A popular brand is facing backlash after asking an influencer to return a bassinet when her baby died.
title: Popular baby brand apologizes after asking mom mourning baby’s death to return SNOO bassinet

description: The FBI announces a new task force aimed at finding whoever is behind several recent attacks on Tesla vehicles, dealerships and charging stations. The electric car company became a flashpoint by those frustrated with CEO Elon Musk and his moves in the federal government. NBC’s Liz Kreutz reports for TODAY.
title: FBI launches task force to crack down on attacks targeting Teslas

description: Top officials reportedly discussed secret U.S. military plans in a group chat with journalist Jeffrey Goldberg from The Atlantic who was inadvertently added. Secretary of State Pete Hegseth says “nobody was texting war plans,” but the national security council spokesperson says it "appears to be an authentic message chain.” NBC’s Garrett Haake reports and NBC’s Hallie Jackson joins with analysis.
title: Hegseth says ‘nobody was texting war plans’ after chat emerges

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth denies “texting war plans” to a group text that included The Atlantic’s editor-in-chief.
title: Military plans shared in Signal chat and 23andMe bankruptcy concerns: Morning Rundown

description: Former FIFA President Sepp Blatter and France soccer great Michel Platini were both cleared of corruption charges by a Swiss court.
title: Ex-FIFA chief Blatter and soccer great Platini cleared in corruption case

description: The food-delivery app and installment lender say they’re offering a flexible alternative to high-interest credit cards. Some see it as a sign of hard times.
title: 'Eat now, pay later'? DoorDash-Klarna deal fuels concerns around loans for takeout

description: A teenager has died after triggering an avalanche, the fourth person killed in snow slides in Alaska this month.
title: Teen killed after triggering avalanche in Alaska, where 4 have died in snow slides this month

description: With genetic testing company 23andMe declaring bankruptcy and courting bidders, the DNA data of millions of users is up for sale, sparking privacy concerns.
title: 23andMe bankruptcy filing sparks privacy fears as DNA data of millions goes up for sale

description: As the Department of Government Efficiency upends federal agencies, a new report released Tuesday by the job listing website Indeed shows the number of workers looking for new jobs has spiked.
title: Job applications surging among DOGE’s targets in federal government

description: University of Southern California women’s basketball star JuJu Watkins was carried off the court Monday night and did not return after suffering an apparent injury during the NCAA tournament.
title: USC star JuJu Watkins carried off injured in Trojans' game against Mississippi State

description: Trump and his allies repeatedly went after Hillary Clinton for not using proper government channels to send messages containing classified material.
title: Trump officials shared military plans on a private app — 10 years after Clinton email controversy

description: Actor Drake Bell told his former Nickelodeon co-star Josh Peck that he worried about the fate of their friendship after he reported allegations of child abuse during their time on “Drake & Josh.”
title: Drake Bell opens up to former co-star Josh Peck following 'Quiet on Set' docuseries

description: A man and two children were found with injuries that were not life-threatening Monday near the wreckage of a small plane on Alaska’s Kenai Peninsula that had been reported overdue the night before, authorities said.
title: Man and 2 children found alive after Alaska plane crash
